page.title: 03Unst Airport - General.
page.content: Unst Airport was built in its present form in 1979,though there was an airstrip there from the 1950s.The airport is run by Airworks Ltd. At this time they have 20 local people employed.Three helicopters are based here,and with fixedwing aircraft there are 30 to 50 flights in and out every day.Every year the runway is rebuilt to stop it from sinking.There are lots of different jobs from the Manager to the tea ladies.Aircraft fly to and from Aberdeen with oilworkers, and Loganair fly a daily scheduled service to Lerwick and Edinburgh. Helicopters,owned by Bristows fly to the different oil rigs owned by Chevron.There are usually a couple of emergency flights a week if helicopters or planes run out of fuel or have some mechanical problem.
